• The contraceptive 
injection. It is 
recommended that you 
wait until six weeks after 
you give birth before 
you are given this. It can 
be given earlier in some 
circumstances. The 
contraceptive injection will 
not	affect	your	milk	supply	
if you are breastfeeding.
• The contraceptive implant. 
This contains a long-
lasting progestogen and is 
effective	for	three	years.	It
